text: Kyiv Civil Activists or Community asset of Kyiv (, Hromadskyi aktyv Kyieva) is a bloc of political parties in the capital of Ukraine, Kyiv. ==History== The coalition was founded by Oleksandr Pabat in 2005 as a non-governmental civic activist organization.Political Pulse: Presidential field takes shape, Kyiv Post (November 11, 2009) During the 2008 local election the party won 5.95% of the votes and 8 seats in the Kyiv City Council. One candidate was removed from the election list in relation the possible involvement in the washing of "dirty money".Ministry of Internal Affairs Faction leader Oleksandr Pabat Пабат Олександр Вікторович , Kyiv City Council is a self-nominated candidate in the 2010 Ukrainian presidential election.Events by themes: Aleksandr Pabat was nominee as a candidate for the President of Ukraine, UNIAN (October 31, 2009) In 2009 Pabat initiated the Peoples' Salvation Army. Александр Пабат, ЛІГА In the 2014 Kyiv local election the party did not win any seats.Nine parties including Democratic Alliance win seats in Kyiv Council, Interfax- Ukraine (2 June 2014) ===Bloc at Kyiv city elections=== In the 2008 local election Kyiv Civil Activists had the following composition: *Liberal Democratic Party of Ukraine *People's Party of depositors and social security *Party of Law Defense ==References== Category:Political party alliances in Ukraine Category:Political parties established in 2005 Category:Political parties in Kyiv
title: Kyiv Civil Activists
